title: ISic000266. I.Sicily inscription 000266
body:
Facsimile Images

Dis · Manibus
Epitynchani · Caes(aris)
n(ostri) ((ivy-leaf)) ser(vi) ((ivy-leaf)) Candidian(i)
qui exiebat · in officio
5Asiae · ark(arii) ((ivy-leaf)) XX · hered(itatium)

Apparatus criticus

Text based upon Bitto 2001 and photograph

English translation

To the shades of the underworld, Epitynchanus Candidianus, slave of our Caesar, died en route to Asia to take up office of treasurer of the 5% inheritance tax.

commentary

bibliography

  • 10.6977 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • 32 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000029
  • 1558 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000352
